components.docblock: Date Range Picker Component that shows a dropdown where you can select a date range.

childrenComponentProp.name: value
childrenComponentProp.docblock: An object that can contain either a window or start/end dates.

description.text: An object that can contain either a window or start/end dates.

childrenComponentProp.name: minDate
childrenComponentProp.docblock: A minimum date. Anything prior to it will be disabled.

description.text: A minimum date. Anything prior to it will be disabled.

childrenComponentProp.name: maxDate
childrenComponentProp.docblock: A maximum date. Anything after it will be disabled.

description.text: A maximum date. Anything after it will be disabled.

childrenComponentProp.name: disabled
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Whether the component is disabled or not.

description.text: Whether the component is disabled or not.

childrenComponentProp.name: dateFormat
childrenComponentProp.docblock: A date format as a string. Check out date-fns's format option for syntax.

description.text: A date format as a string. Check out date-fns's format option for syntax.

childrenComponentProp.name: ranges
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
An object with labels as keys and tuples shaped as [startDate, endDate] as values. Those will be used as
the window ranges that will be available for selection. See getDatePickerRanges function for more info.
For disabling ranges, set this to empty list.

description.text:
An object with labels as keys and tuples shaped as [startDate, endDate] as values. Those will be used as
the window ranges that will be available for selection. See getDatePickerRanges function for more info.
For disabling ranges, set this to empty list.

childrenComponentProp.name: inputRanges
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
An object with labels as keys and an object shaped as {interval, endDate} as values. Those will be used as
the input ranges that will be available for selection. See getDatePickerInputRanges function for more info.
For disabling input ranges, set this to empty list.

description.text:
An object with labels as keys and an object shaped as {interval, endDate} as values. Those will be used as
the input ranges that will be available for selection. See getDatePickerInputRanges function for more info.
For disabling input ranges, set this to empty list.

childrenComponentProp.name: placement
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Sets the direction of the calendar overlay.

description.text: Sets the direction of the calendar overlay.

childrenComponentProp.name: numCalendarMonths
childrenComponentProp.docblock: The amount of calendar months that will be rendered.

description.text: The amount of calendar months that will be rendered.

childrenComponentProp.name: calendarDirection
childrenComponentProp.docblock: The direction of calendar months. This is only relevant when you have more than one as numCalendarMonths.

description.text: The direction of calendar months. This is only relevant when you have more than one as numCalendarMonths.

childrenComponentProp.name: disabledDates
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
A list of dates that will be disabled for selection. For the purpose of specifying a valid selection interval,
use minDate and maxDate props instead.

description.text:
A list of dates that will be disabled for selection. For the purpose of specifying a valid selection interval,
use minDate and maxDate props instead.

childrenComponentProp.name: onChange
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Callback invoked when the date range changes. This function is invoked with an object that can contain either
a window or start/end dates.

description.text:
Callback invoked when the date range changes. This function is invoked with an object that can contain either
a window or start/end dates.
Date Range Picker Component that shows a dropdown where you can select a date range.

components.docblock:
Component that can be used to show specific components depending on the current state.

If the state is currently loading, the Loading component, if specified, should be shown.
In case of an error or that data could not be found, an Error page is displayed.
When the state is not loading and there are no errors, the specified component is rendered.

childrenComponentProp.name: component
childrenComponentProp.docblock: React component that should be rendered inside this wrapper

description.text: React component that should be rendered inside this wrapper

childrenComponentProp.name: loader
childrenComponentProp.docblock: React component that should be shown when `loading` is set to `true`

description.text: React component that should be shown when `loading` is set to `true`

childrenComponentProp.name: loading
childrenComponentProp.docblock: When this prop is `true`, the Loader component is shown

description.text: When this prop is `true`, the Loader component is shown

childrenComponentProp.name: found
childrenComponentProp.docblock: When this prop is `false`, the `PageNotFound` component is shown

description.text: When this prop is `false`, the `PageNotFound` component is shown

childrenComponentProp.name: error
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Error message that should be show. The message is shown using the `ErrorPage` component.
You can pass a component function or a simple message as a string.

description.text:
Error message that should be show. The message is shown using the `ErrorPage` component.
You can pass a component function or a simple message as a string.

Component that can be used to show specific components depending on the current state.

If the state is currently loading, the Loading component, if specified, should be shown.
In case of an error or that data could not be found, an Error page is displayed.
When the state is not loading and there are no errors, the specified component is rendered.

formatted string value, year and month arguments.

components.docblock:
Component that behaves as a wrapper around `react-select` component in order
to create a unified API between different version of the original component.

Please checkout `react-select` documentation for usage.

childrenComponentProp.name: value
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Currently selected value. Provide an array of values when multi prop is set.

description.text: Currently selected value. Provide an array of values when multi prop is set.

childrenComponentProp.name: disabled
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Whether the component is disabled or not.

description.text: Whether the component is disabled or not.

childrenComponentProp.name: valueKey
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Key used to extract the value from the options object.

description.text: Key used to extract the value from the options object.

childrenComponentProp.name: labelKey
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Key used to extract the label from the options object.

description.text: Key used to extract the label from the options object.

childrenComponentProp.name: options
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
An array of option objects available for selection. If the label is not present, then the
value will be displayed. How the value/label will be extracted from the option objects depends on
the valueKey and labelKey props respectively. This prop is required, unless async and loadOptions
props are set.

description.text:
An array of option objects available for selection. If the label is not present, then the
value will be displayed. How the value/label will be extracted from the option objects depends on
the valueKey and labelKey props respectively. This prop is required, unless async and loadOptions
props are set.

childrenComponentProp.name: loadOptions
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Callback used to load options asynchronously. It can also be a Promise. This must be set when in
async mode.

description.text:
Callback used to load options asynchronously. It can also be a Promise. This must be set when in
async mode.

childrenComponentProp.name: isLoading
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Whether the component should show a loading indicator. This is handled automatically when async prop
is set.

description.text:
Whether the component should show a loading indicator. This is handled automatically when async prop
is set.

childrenComponentProp.name: clearable
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Whether a clear button will be displayed, for easily resetting the value prop.

description.text: Whether a clear button will be displayed, for easily resetting the value prop.

childrenComponentProp.name: creatable
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Whether options can be created by user input when they do not exist already.

description.text: Whether options can be created by user input when they do not exist already.

childrenComponentProp.name: multi
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Whether multiple values can be selected at once. Otherwise this component will behave as a normal combo box.

description.text: Whether multiple values can be selected at once. Otherwise this component will behave as a normal combo box.

childrenComponentProp.name: async
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Whether to load the data from a promise or a callback. Options prop is optional when this is set.

description.text: Whether to load the data from a promise or a callback. Options prop is optional when this is set.

Component that behaves as a wrapper around `react-select` component in order
to create a unified API between different version of the original component.

Please checkout `react-select` documentation for usage.

childrenComponentProp.name: defaultValue
childrenComponentProp.docblock: The default value for the select field.

description.text: The default value for the select field.

childrenComponentProp.name: options
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
An array of option objects available for selection. If the label is not present, then the
value will be displayed. How the value/label will be extracted from the option objects depends on
the valueKey and labelKey props respectively. This prop is required, unless async and loadOptions
props are set.

description.text:
An array of option objects available for selection. If the label is not present, then the
value will be displayed. How the value/label will be extracted from the option objects depends on
the valueKey and labelKey props respectively. This prop is required, unless async and loadOptions
props are set.

childrenComponentProp.name: loadOptions
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Callback used to load options asynchronously. It can also be a Promise. This must be set when in
async mode.

description.text:
Callback used to load options asynchronously. It can also be a Promise. This must be set when in
async mode.

childrenComponentProp.name: isLoading
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Whether the component should show a loading indicator. This is handled automatycally when async prop
is set.

description.text:
Whether the component should show a loading indicator. This is handled automatycally when async prop
is set.

childrenComponentProp.name: clearable
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Whether a clear button will be displayed, for easily resetting the value prop.

description.text: Whether a clear button will be displayed, for easily resetting the value prop.

childrenComponentProp.name: creatable
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Whether options can be created by user input when they do not exist already.

description.text: Whether options can be created by user input when they do not exist already.

childrenComponentProp.name: multi
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Whether multiple values can be selected at once. Otherwise this component will behave as a normal combo box.

description.text: Whether multiple values can be selected at once. Otherwise this component will behave as a normal combo box.

childrenComponentProp.name: async
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Whether to load the data from a promise or a callback. Options prop is optional when this is set.

description.text: Whether to load the data from a promise or a callback. Options prop is optional when this is set.

childrenComponentProp.name: onChangeValue
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Callback function that returns the value of the input when it's changed.

description.text: Callback function that returns the value of the input when it's changed.

childrenComponentProp.name: onChangeWithValue
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
Passing the onChangeWithValue prop means the React-Select 'value' key will be used
onChangeValue.

If this is false, the entire option object is stored, meaning additional data
can be stored onChangeValue if needed.

description.text:
Passing the onChangeWithValue prop means the React-Select 'value' key will be used
onChangeValue.

If this is false, the entire option object is stored, meaning additional data
can be stored onChangeValue if needed.
Component that encapsulates the `react-select` component.

components.docblock:
Renders a Bootstrap Row component with a Button toolbar on the right hand side.
Toolbar contains 2 buttons, one that would reset the form state and one that would
submit the form data.

childrenComponentProp.name: enabled
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Is the form enabled

description.text: Is the form enabled

childrenComponentProp.name: pristine
childrenComponentProp.docblock:
When this property is `false` it means that the forms field values
have been changed. Meaning the form is in a `dirty` state.

description.text:
When this property is `false` it means that the forms field values
have been changed. Meaning the form is in a `dirty` state.

childrenComponentProp.name: submitting
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Is the form being submitted

description.text: Is the form being submitted

childrenComponentProp.name: submitFailed
childrenComponentProp.docblock: When this property is `true` it means the form submit hook threw an error

description.text: When this property is `true` it means the form submit hook threw an error

childrenComponentProp.name: valid
childrenComponentProp.docblock: When this property is `false` it means that the forms has invalid values

description.text: When this property is `false` it means that the forms has invalid values

childrenComponentProp.name: error
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Error message to be shown in the component

description.text: Error message to be shown in the component

childrenComponentProp.name: reset
childrenComponentProp.docblock: Callback function invoked when the reset button is clicked

description.text: Callback function invoked when the reset button is clicked

Renders a Bootstrap Row component with a Button toolbar on the right hand side.
Toolbar contains 2 buttons, one that would reset the form state and one that would
submit the form data.
